intro: Acronia depressa, commonly known as the dwarf acronia, is a small flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
